response.answer_text: Its a myth US forces came to NZ to defend it ..no yanks took part in any defensive exercises alongside NZ troops nor occupied defenses like coastal batteries .. We also had 11,000 trained men in camps waiting to be sent to the Middle East when the Marines arrived and those men still went to fight at El Alamein .. The first US Marines to arrive here had been in San Diego waiting to be sent to the Phillipines .. As US Forces were being mobilised and trained they had to go somewhere .. It was noted in 1942 how well trained USN and Navy personnel were .. However most US Army troops out here were teenagers with only basic training ..

as a staging area for future operations. u.s. forces came to samoa(all), new hebrides(vanuatu), new caledonia/efate, wallis, fiji(taking over defense responsibility in may42) with land & air forces to protect the pacific LOCs & approaches to New Zealand/Oz.
